alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 11:04AM EDT until April 10 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EDT Sunday was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 4.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.0 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.1 Sun 10 a 4.5 4.3 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EDT.
